question: What tier are we in now and who does it include?
answer:
• We are working through Tiers 1 and 2.1 until February 1.
  • Tier 1:
    • Medical Staff.
    • Dentists, Dental Hygienists and Dental Assistants.
    • Pharmacists, Pharmacy Techs and Aides.
    • Public Health and Emergency Response Workers.
  • Tier 2.1:
    • Educators.
    • Frontline Essential Workers that are high risk of exposure.
    • Adults 65 years of Age and Older.

question: If I am in one of those categories, how do I schedule my vaccine  appointment?
answer:
• Call Family Medical Clinic 208-549-4424
  • We have added additional staff for vaccine scheduling
  • Please be patient – with the large volume of calls we are working to answer and return calls as quickly as possible
  • If you leave a message, it may be after hours before we can return those phone calls.
  • We cannot do vaccines as walk-ins, you need to schedule for a vaccine appointment.

question: When does the next tier open?
Are you scheduling for future tiers yet?
Do you have enough vaccines for everyone in each tier?
answer:
• We are scheduling those tiers with confidence that the health district is going to be able to get us the vaccines that we need.
  • By scheduling your appointment it helps us provide the information we need to get the adequate number of vaccines.

question: Will you notify me when it is time for the second shot?
answer: • If you have been in for your first shot our scheduler will notify you when it is time for your next vaccine.

question: How do we know there will be enough of the second shot if you don’t know how many doses are being allocated to our County?
answer: • We work closely with the health district to make sure that they set aside enough for the second doses.

question: Can I select whether I want the Pfizer or Maderna vaccine?
answer:
• No
  • Right now we are offering Moderna due to the ease of storage and availability.

question: What type of side effects may occur and will they require me to miss work or have someone care for me?
answer:
• Most people experience mild side affects.
  • Your arm may be sore, red and warm to touch.
  • Others have reported headaches or fever. This is a sign that your immune system is working and building up protection to the disease.

question: Why is there so much inconsistency about the COVID and the vaccine?
answer: • This is still a new virus and new vaccine.

question: Why do I still have to wear a mask after I am vaccinated?
answer: • We can be immune and still be a carrier.

question: I am not 65 and I am a high risk person, when can I get a vaccine?
answer: • At this time we do not know when the allocation will include anyone who is high risk and under 65. We will let you know as soon as we are made aware.

question: What if I have more questions about the Vaccine?
answer:
• We will be putting vaccine updates on the Weiser Memorial Hospital and Family Medical Center webpages, and our Facebook pages every Monday and Thursday.
  • This will include scheduling information.
  • Watch Living In The News and check the Weiser Signal American
